title: Lost Read/Unread Columns and Get Messages Now
content:
I just got a couple of new monitors and afterwards the text in Thunderbird showed up in microscopic text. I couldn't get it to enlarge. Thunderbird thought it was up to date, but it was also on 38 something, which I guess is a pretty old version.

Anyway I just updated to 128 ESR and I was able to get the font sizes OK, but there are some things I liked that are missing.

1) Above the folders column that shows all the various inboxes and other folders there used to be a button labeled "Get Messages Now". Now there is a button that says "+New Message" . How do I get the Get Messages Now button back?

2) The folders used to display the total messages in a folder in one column and the number unread in another column. Now it just displays the number unread. How do I get the total messages in the folder column back?
creator: wdolson

title: Mail keeps vanishing, and other problems
content:
I have been having multiple, and increasing, problems since the most recent update:

  • When I load TBird, it says "No message found" and my mailbox appears empty.
  • After I enter my password, my existing mail appears.
  • Program freezes up if I try to do anything while it's checking for new messages, I can't read or respond to messages until it's finished downloading. (I used to be able to do this.)
  • "Leave messages on server" is set to OFF, but the program frequently downloads duplicate messages after downloading mail. It is also checking for new messages much too often.
  • When I delete a message from my inbox or move one to a folder, all the mail vanishes again and I need to close the program and restart.

All of this is making what should be minor actions take forever, and I'm worried about the problems getting worse and immobilizing me. Would greatly appreciate any help. Thank you!
creator: elkatd

title: Cannot delete an email account! Need serious help.
content:
Okay, I have done everything to delete a gmail email account in the 128.6.1esr (64-bit) version of Thunderbird.

1 - In Account Settings = deleted the entire email account 2 - Deleted any association with calendar 3 - Had tech support person (my own) remote in, spend 1/2 hour and could not find what else needed to be deleted.

Here's the thing: I get a popup from google saying xxxx@gmail.com saying:

"Sign in to continue to Mozilla Thunderbird email"

Create Account ....... Next

Click on Next = 404 error (and Google says nothing can be done about it in so many words) Click on Create Account = "something went wrong"

Can someone help? This popup occurs about every 5 minutes and I cannot receive *or* send email while the popup is open. So annoying.


Thanks in advance.

title: OAuth2 support for hosted email providers
content:
Hi,

One my customer is looking for OAuth2 support for their hosted email services. After lot of research I came to know that Oauth provider URLS and clientids are hard-coded in OAuth2Providers.jsm

https://fossies.org/linux/seamonkey/comm/mailnews/base/util/OAuth2Providers.jsm

As per my understanding it is not feasible to customize OAuth2 providers without modifying above file. Also it looks like OAuth providers have monopolized the email service market by few vendors like Gmail, Outlook. vy offering Multi-Factor based authentication and passowrd less authentication which is MUST have security feature from many of our customers. It is really against OpenSource philosohy and there is no scope small/medium/large service provider to host OAuth2 service.

My customer is interested looking for customizable provider and will be ready to pay for this feature.

As I know TB has no commericial support, but I would like to understand if it feasible with some sort of commecial agreement

Thanks, Himanshu
creator: himanshuj_mohan

title: thunderbird migratie naar nieuwe machine
content:
Hallo,

Bij een migratie van een oude iMac (MacOS Ventura) naar een nieuwe PowerBook M4 (MacOS Sequoia) krijg ik de melding dat “Thunderbird v128.6” beschadigd is …. En dus niet meer bruikbaar.

Ik heb van de oude iMac de volledige map Thunderbird User /Bibliotheek/Thunderbird A. Klassiek gekopieerd (Copy-paste) naar externe SSD B. Via het voorgestelde wijze met Control -> Kopieer en Plak via externe SSD Dan deze map geplakt op delfde plaats in de Bibliotheek op de MacBook M4. De gemigreerde TB-app verwijderd en een nieuw geïnstalleerd. Na de vervanging vindt “TB v128.6.1” de DATA (email-adressen en alle emails) NIET meer, de adressen,….. wel.

Wat doe ik verkeerd ?

Hoe nu oplossen? Rudy

in hetEngels

During a migration from an old iMac (MacOS Ventura) to a new PowerBook M4 (MacOS Sequoia), I receive the message that "Thunderbird v128.6" is corrupted and therefore no longer usable.I copied the entire folder Thunderbird User / Library / Thunderbird from the old iMac: A. Classic copy-paste to an external SSD B. Via the suggested method with Control -> Copy and Paste via the external SSD. Then I pasted this folder in the same location in the Library on the MacBook M4.The migrated TB app was deleted and a new one was installed.After this replacement, "TB v128.6.1" can no longer find the DATA (email addresses and all emails), only the addresses are available.What am I doing wrong?How can I resolve this?Rudy
creator: rudy.v

title: Thunderbird + Firefox crash
content:
I have a new Macbook M4, with Firefox 134.0.2 as default browser and Thunderbird 128.6.1esr as defaukt email application. When both are running, I often get the following problem:

I click the red close dot (pardon me if I don't know the terminology) on the upper left to close Thunderbird. Now the same red dot in Firefox vanishes--not greyed out, it simply disappears. I can't close or minimize (yellow dot) Firefox.

When I attempt to reopen Thunderbird by clicking the icon in the dock, nothing happens. It won't open.

I quit Firefox with cmd-Q, and find this (see attached screen shot): a little white square in the upper left corner, which does not open or change when I click elsewhere on the desktop, and a truncated Thunderbird menu.

I have no weird add-ons in either app.

Finally, if Firefox is not running, I don't experience this issue with Thunderbird. Only when both are active. It thus seems like a Mozilla bug. I wish I can solve this, as it drives me mad. Note also that I've used Firefox and Thunderbird in Windows for many, many years without problem. I have just switched to Mac for the first time and am a completely inexperienced Mac user.
creator: larry171

title: Thunderbird on Debian - How to enforce Antivirus setting to be enabled?
content:
Hi everyone, I have a fleet of machines running debian and I would like the Thunderbird setting "Allow antivirus clients to quarantine individual incoming messages" to be always enabled.

It doesn't appear to be supported by the policies.json method of setting it up.

Is there a way to enforce it?

I'm also aware of the option to create an user.js file in the profile folder with the content "user_pref("mailnews.downloadToTempFile", true);"

But this method requires to create the profile first and then know it's location. Is there a "profile template" that I can edit to set that preference how I need it?

Thank you in advance Lore

title: Emails disappearing - HELP!
content:
I have only been using Thunderbird since I got a new laptop early in November 2024.

I have just noticed today that all emails older than 14 days have vanished from my inbox! Also, some (but strangely, not all) older mails have vanished from various sub-folders I set up.

I searched the forum, but the answers I found relate to a setting that I do not have in Thunderbird.

I am using Sky email, which is an IMAP server. On my old laptop I used Outlook 2010 and old emails NEVER disappeared - when I look at it now, I can see all the mails which have vanished on Thunderbird. So I know they are still on the server.

Please help! Thanks, Mark.
creator: MarkWatson26
